pledges.name: We pledge to evaluate risk, so that fundamental rights are not negatively affected.
We pledge to enable human agency, so that users retain autonomy.
We pledge that there will be human oversight, so that human values are upheld.
We pledge that our systems will be safe and secure, so that they cannot be misused by bad actors.
We pledge that our systems will be robust, so as to minimise risk and prevent harm.
We pledge that our systems will be resistant to attacks and protected against vulnerabilities, so that our systems and data are safe.
We pledge to put in place safeguards, so that the system will not be compromised in case of problems.
We pledge to consider unintended consequences and errors, so that no harm comes to living beings or the environment.
We pledge to put in place evaluation processes, so that we support, mitigate and correct unintended risks.
We pledge to demonstrate reproducible results, so that we can accurately describe the system.
We guarantee privacy and data protection throughout the system’s entire lifecycle, in order to protect users
We guarantee the integrity of data, in order to enforce biases, inaccuracies, errors and mistakes.
We pledge to put in place data protocols governing data access, in order to protect individuals' data.
We pledge to document processes leading to AI decisions, in order to identify reasons in the case of mistakes.
We pledge to make AI decisions that can be understood and traced by human beings, in order that we can explain those decisions.
We pledge to make all AI systems identifiable, in order that people can decide whether to accept any interaction.
We pledge to consider and involve all affected stakeholders, to enable diversity and inclusion.
We pledge to use only data sets that are free of bias and complete, in order not to perpetuate unfairness.
We pledge to make systems accessible to as wide a range of users as possible, in order that they benefit from equitable access and participation.
We pledge to consult stakeholders, in order to develop trustworthy systems.
We pledge to consider the environment a stakeholder, in order that our systems are sustainable and ecologically responsible.
We pledge to scrutinise the system's processes and supply chains, so that it is environmentally friendly.
We pledge to monitor the system's effect on society, so that we do not damage people's mental or physical wellbeing.
We pledge to monitor the system's effect on society, so that we do not damage institutions, democracy or society at large.
We pledge that all decisions will be explainable, so that they can be verified.
We pledge to make our Responsibility Dashboard public, so that we can be held accountable.
We pledge to make public our certifications, so that we can be held accountable.
We pledge to open channels of communication, so that we can be held accountable.

We pledge that there will be human oversight, so that human values are upheld.

We pledge to put in place data protocols governing data access, in order to protect individuals' data.

We pledge to make AI decisions that can be understood and traced by human beings, in order that we can explain those decisions.
We pledge to make all AI systems identifiable, in order that people can decide whether to accept any interaction.
We pledge to consider and involve all affected stakeholders, to enable diversity and inclusion.
We pledge to use only data sets that are free of bias and complete, in order not to perpetuate unfairness.
We pledge to make systems accessible to as wide a range of users as possible, in order that they benefit from equitable access and participation.
We pledge to consult stakeholders, in order to develop trustworthy systems.
We pledge to consider the environment a stakeholder, in order that our systems are sustainable and ecologically responsible.
We pledge to scrutinise the system's processes and supply chains, so that it is environmentally friendly.
We pledge to monitor the system's effect on society, so that we do not damage people's mental or physical wellbeing.
We pledge to monitor the system's effect on society, so that we do not damage institutions, democracy or society at large.
We pledge to demonstrate that our products are beneficial, necessary, and are deserving of the resources they use.
We pledge that all decisions will be explainable, so that they can be verified.
We pledge to make our Responsibility Dashboard public, so that we can be held accountable.
We pledge to make public our certifications, so that we can be held accountable.
We pledge to open channels of communication, so that we can be held accountable.
We pledge to operate as an independent company sustained by profits.
We pledge to have a meaningful impact through rewilding, reforestation and conservation projects.
We pledge that our revenue structure will sustain our services over the long term.
We pledge to demonstrate that nature and conservation are economically viable services.
We pledge to work in ways that are transparent.
We pledge to explain the methodologies we use.
We pledge to provide tools for members to independently verify the impact of the projects they invest in.
We pledge to explain the methodologies we use.
We pledge to provide tools for members to independently verify the impact of the projects they invest in.
We pledge to make it possible for contributors to verify the impact of their contribution to a project in person.
We pledge to provide tree imagery and GPS coordinates of planting areas soon after planting, to members and customers.
We pledge to monitor planted areas over time, and publish progress updates from the field.
We pledge to make tree numbers and species lists publicly available via online maps.
We pledge to provide 'before' and 'after' photos so that members can see how the forest has grown and changed over time.
We pledge to respond to your questions.
We pledge to make public our data and findings.
We pledge to provide evidence from secondary-research of peer-reviewed literature that our carbon sequestration predictions are justified.
We pledge to deliver transparency through technology.
We pledge to share our selection process for rewilding projects.
We pledge to demonstrate additionality by establishing that there is a clear cost to inaction.
We pledge to demonstrate that a project achieves one or more of our key rewilding objectives.
We pledge to provide evidence of broader socio-economic and environmental benefits.
We pledge to back up predictions with scientific evidence and acknowledge remaining uncertainties.
We pledge to consider the big picture including other stakeholders.
We pledge to address any underlying causes of ecological degradation.
